titlestmt.titleproper: Yale Graduate Student Union Records TAM.233
titlestmt.author: Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:44:04 -0400.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Provenance unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.095.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Yale University graduate students / graduate teaching assistants attempted to organize labor unions in the 1980s-1990s. The two key organizations were the Graduate Employees and Student Organization, and the Graduate Student Union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes GESO Voice: newsletter of the Graduate Employees and Student Organizations, notes from meetings, findings from a graduate student employee survey, newspaper clippings, research re: other graduate student attempts to organize, statements from the Graduate Student Union and officials from Yale University and a timeline of teaching assistant solidarity at Yale.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in circa 1988-circa 1992, are expected to enter the public domain in 2112.
